intro: Scilla picta, commonly known as the painted scilla, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in woodland and rocky habitats. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers in early spring, followed by narrow, grass-like leaves. Its bulbs are perennial, allowing it to return year after year in suitable conditions. Scilla picta is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to naturalize in gardens.
